bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:49.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/49.0 Build Identifier:
When installing python3-tzlocal on Fedora 24, tzlocal don't work due to missing dependency with pytz.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. On a clean Fedora installation, at least one without python3-pytz pre-installed 2. dnf install python3-tzlocal 3. python3 -c "import tzlocal"
Actual Results: Traceback (most recent call last): File "<string>", line 1, in <module> File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tzlocal/__init__.py", line 7, in <module> from tzlocal.unix import get_localzone, reload_localzone File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/tzlocal/unix.py", line 4, in <module> import pytz ImportError: No module named 'pytz'
I think this is due to misplaced requires line. The python3-pytz requires is added to python-tzlocal (the Python 2 package) instead of python3-tzlocal.
A simple workaround is to explicitly install python3-pytz which solve this issue.
Also this bug seems still present in rawhide (misplaced requires line is present in latest master of http://pkgs.fedoraproject.org/cgit/rpms/python-tzlocal.git)
python-tzlocal-1.2-6.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-515dd5d22e

python-tzlocal-1.2-6.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-cc3b8a4fce
